channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How a member of HR helped a woman diagnosed with breast cancer
item.description: When Gillian Kline was diagnosed with breast cancer, she had one day to figure out a health insurance plan at her workplace. She didn't know what to do — until HR team member Alex Mackey got involved.
item.content:encoded: When Gillian Kline was diagnosed with breast cancer, she had one day to figure out a health insurance plan at her workplace. She didn't know what to do — until HR team member Alex Mackey got involved.

item.title: This NPR College Podcast Challenge finalist might change how you hear your commute
item.description: Student Bennett Cook recorded ambient sounds on his way to campus and found something surprising. His resulting podcast — a finalist in NPR's College Podcast Challenge — may change your commute.
item.content:encoded: Student Bennett Cook recorded ambient sounds on his way to campus and found something surprising. His resulting podcast — a finalist in NPR's College Podcast Challenge — may change your commute.
item.dc:creator: Janet W. Lee

item.title: Republican lawmakers push back on Trump's expansive use of executive power
item.description: Republican lawmakers are occasionally pushing back on President Trump's expansive use of executive power, but will that trend hold?
item.content:encoded: Republican lawmakers are occasionally pushing back on President Trump's expansive use of executive power, but will that trend hold?
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: EU leaders react with alarm to Trump administration's new national security statement
item.description: Analysts say the latest release of the U.S. National Security Strategy reveals big differences in how the U.S. and European Union view the Russia-Ukraine war.
item.content:encoded: Analysts say the latest release of the U.S. National Security Strategy reveals big differences in how the U.S. and European Union view the Russia-Ukraine war.
item.dc:creator: Teri Schultz

item.title: What to know about the college football playoff
item.description: The 12 teams playing in the college football playoff are set. We discuss the highlights, lowlights and surprises.
item.content:encoded: The 12 teams playing in the college football playoff are set. We discuss the highlights, lowlights and surprises.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Farmers say Trump's payment isn't enough amid rising health care costs
item.description: President Trump announced $12 billion in one-time payments to farmers as they adjust to increased tariffs on exports. Some farmers say even with that help they still face rising health care costs.
item.content:encoded: President Trump announced $12 billion in one-time payments to farmers as they adjust to increased tariffs on exports. Some farmers say even with that help they still face rising health care costs.
item.dc:creator: Drew Hawkins

item.title: When Christmas is a little too bright ... look to Krampus
item.description: If Santa Claus is the good cop of Christmas, then Krampus is the bad one: a creature from European folklore who scares children into behaving themselves, complete with goat horns and gnashing teeth.
item.content:encoded:
If Santa Claus is the good cop of Christmas, then Krampus is the bad one: a creature from European folklore who scares children into behaving themselves, complete with goat horns and gnashing teeth.

(Image credit: Celeste Noche for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: Federal grazing permits and subsidies benefit the wealthiest ranchers
item.description: Government grazing permits are much cheaper than market price, and a new investigation by High Country News and ProPublica finds most of the cost savings benefit billionaire ranchers and corporations.
item.content:encoded: Government grazing permits are much cheaper than market price, and a new investigation by High Country News and ProPublica finds most of the cost savings benefit billionaire ranchers and corporations.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Some Mormons take issue with BYU's sports funding
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Kevin Reynolds, who has reported on Brigham Young University's efforts to attract star athletes and coaches, which some say are in conflict with religious principles.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Kevin Reynolds, who has reported on Brigham Young University's efforts to attract star athletes and coaches, which some say are in conflict with religious principles.
item.dc:creator: Jason Fuller

item.title: Paramount's hostile bid on Warner Bros
item.description: It only took a weekend. Paramount is jumping into the fray with a hostile takeover bid, challenging Netflix's deal to buy Warner Bros. Discovery. Paramount's offer is valued at over $108 billion.
item.content:encoded: It only took a weekend. Paramount is jumping into the fray with a hostile takeover bid, challenging Netflix's deal to buy Warner Bros. Discovery. Paramount's offer is valued at over $108 billion.
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan
